basics.name: Ryan Lin
basics.summary: Motivated undergraduate student at Caltech pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science.

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

courses: Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science (Discrete Mathematics)
Calculus of One and Several Variables and Linear Algebra

awards.title: FIRST Tech Challenge Dean's Award Semi-Finalist
Stanford Online High School Math Division Award

projects.name: Quantum ML Models
projects.summary: Explored structural and mathematical parallels of a Convolutional Neural Network and a Quantum Circuit. Implemented a hybrid quantum/classical binary classification model using Pennylane and TensorFlow

projects.name: Stock Prediction Using LSTMs With Sentiment Analysis
projects.summary: Implemented a multivariable LSTM model in R to predict the trajectory of any given ticker. Notable considered variables include previous time series data and a sentiment analysis on news headers.

projects.name: Y86 Architecture Simulation
projects.summary: Programmed and implemented a simulator of a processor and assembler in Y86, a simplified version of X86.
